isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - ENGINE COOLANT LEVEL SYSTEM - STEEL SURGE TANKS

svcproc.title: STEEL SURGE TANKS
svcproc.para: Steel surge tanks use a conductive probe that allows the probe to be grounded when the coolant level is full. This causes the voltage at pin 10 to be 0 volts. If the coolant level is low the probe circuit is open and a 12 volt signal is present at pin 10 of the ECM indicating low coolant. If using a steel surge tank, it is necessary for the ECM to be programmed for a steel tank.
